original: Jakobsson, Uno Rupert Martin, major, Uddevalla, f. 12/12/92 i Gbg av överlär. Martin J. o. Lotten Johansson. G. 20 m. Aina Nycander. Barn: Hervor f. 23, skolkökslär., Gbg, Clas-Uno 24, elev v. Operask., Håkan-Uno 26, marining., kadett, Gbg. — Stud:ex. i Gbg 12, oiff :ex. 14, gymn :dir :ku;rs 17-20, g;as,skyddsikurs 26. Und:löjtn. v. Bohusl. reg. 14, löjtn. 16, kapt. 29, major i armén 43. Reg:adj. 21-27, chef f. andra ’komp. 3tl,, reg :’kvartermäst. o. reg :istabschef 34-38. Repr. f. armén v. fäkttävl. i Oistende 30. Hobbies: fäktning, segliinig. RSO, LingJubM.
translated: Jakobsson, Uno Rupert Martin, Major, Uddevalla, born December 12, 1892 in Gothenburg to headmaster Martin J. and Lotten Johansson. Married in 1920 to Aina Nycander. Children: Hervor born in 1923, a school kitchen teacher in Gothenburg, Clas-Uno born in 1924, a student at the Opera School, and Håkan-Uno born in 1926, a naval cadet in Gothenburg. He completed his secondary education in Gothenburg in 1912, officer training in 1914, gymnasium director course in 1917-1920, and gas protection course in 1926. He served as a second lieutenant in the Bohuslän regiment in 1914, was promoted to lieutenant in 1916, captain in 1929, and became a major in the army in 1943. He was regimental adjutant from 1921-1927, commanding officer of the second company of the regiment, quartermaster and chief of staff of the regiment from 1934-1938. Represented the army in fencing in Ostend in 1930. His hobbies were fencing and sailing. He was awarded the Royal Order of the Sword (RSO) and the Ling Jubilee Medal.
